alert.note: Alert for Northern Clearwater Mountains; Southern Clearwater Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 07 at 4:01AM MST until January 07 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations for valleys of 8 to 16 inches. 16 to 24 inches possible for Lolo Pass, with 2 to 3 feet possible in the highest terrain. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph causing blowing and drifting snow in the terrain and over mountain passes. * WHERE...Elk River, Highway 11 Pierce to Headquarters, Pierce, Highway 12 Lowell to Lolo Pass, Elk City, and Dixie. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 AM PST this morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Monday afternoon through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible Monday night into Wednesday morning. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Northern Clearwater Mountains; Southern Clearwater Mountains
